p: The classic pour plate technique was used to determine the minimum fungicidal concentration (MFC) ( National Committee for Clinical Laboratory Standards, 1997). Concentrations that showed no Candida species growth from previous MIC experiments were transferred to Petri dishes, then 15 ml of melted PDA was poured over it and gently rotated and left to solidify. Inoculated Petri dishes were incubated at 37Â° for 48 h. The lowest concentration that showed no visible Candida species colonies were recorded as MFC ( Ababutain, 2019). All experiments were performed in three replicates.
